text: Olga Nawoja Tokarczuk (; born 29 January 1962) is a Polish writer and activist. In 2018, she won the Man Booker International Prize for her novel Flights, becoming the first Polish writer to do so. She was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature for the year 2018 (awarded in 2019). ==References== Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Polish essayists Category:Polish activists Category:Polish Nobel Prize winners
title: Olga Tokarczuk
